description: An island in the Grand Line, home to the Teena Geena Kingdom. Brook was sent here and displayed as a freak show attraction.

keyEvents.title: Brook's Performance at Kenzan Island
keyEvents.description: Brook is displayed in a cage as a freak show attraction while holding a newspaper and reflecting on Luffy's kindness.

keyEvents.title: Brook Performs 'Bone to Be Wild'
keyEvents.description: Brook performs his new single for the crowd at the freak show.

significance: The location where Brook spent part of his time during the two-year separation, developing his musical career.

description: A dark and gloomy island in the Grand Line, once home to the fallen Shikkearu Kingdom. Currently inhabited by Dracule Mihawk and infested with Humandrills that mimic sword techniques.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Asks Mihawk for Training
keyEvents.description: Zoro kneels before Mihawk and requests training to become a stronger swordsman.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Reveals He Defeated All Humandrills
keyEvents.description: Zoro informs Mihawk that he has defeated all the Humandrills on the island.

keyEvents.title: Mihawk Understands Zoro's Motivation
keyEvents.description: Mihawk realizes Zoro wants to become stronger for Luffy, not for himself.

keyEvents.title: Mihawk Agrees to Train Zoro
keyEvents.description: Mihawk agrees to train Zoro once Perona heals his injuries.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Explains 3D2Y Message
keyEvents.description: Zoro decodes Luffy's hidden message to Perona at Kuraigana Island.

significance: The primary training ground for Roronoa Zoro during the two-year timeskip, where he trains under Dracule Mihawk, the World's Greatest Swordsman.

description: An island in the Grand Line labeled as the 'Island of White Soil.' It served as the Revolutionary Army's headquarters for years.

keyEvents.title: Robin Decides to Go to Baltigo
keyEvents.description: Nico Robin decides to join the Revolutionary Army and travel to Baltigo to meet Monkey D. Dragon.

significance: The Revolutionary Army headquarters where Nico Robin spent her two-year training period learning from Monkey D. Dragon and the revolutionaries.

statusHistory.description: Destroyed during battle with Blackbeard Pirates

description: A series of flower-shaped islands in Paradise. The islands are actually giant carnivorous plants known as 'Stomach Baron' that consume overweight animals. Home to the Forest of Gluttony.

keyEvents.title: Usopp Begins Training
keyEvents.description: Usopp resolves to train seriously for Luffy's sake, and Heracles begins teaching him about Pop Greens.

significance: The location where Usopp trained for two years with Heracles, learning about Pop Greens and survival techniques that would become crucial for his fighting style.

description: A massive bridge in East Blue where slaves are forced to work. This is where Nico Robin was sent by Bartholomew Kuma and where she encountered the Revolutionary Army.

keyEvents.title: Robin Meets with Revolutionary Army
keyEvents.description: Robin speaks with members of the Revolutionary Army under the giant bridge, deciding to join them to meet Dragon.

significance: The location where Robin made contact with the Revolutionary Army and decided to train with them.

description: An archipelago located near the Red Line, consisting of several islands formed by the roots of the giant Yarukiman Mangroves. Known for its soap bubbles that float up from the ground.

keyEvents.title: Planned Reunion Location
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates commit to reuniting at Sabaody Archipelago after two years of training.

significance: The designated reunion point for the Straw Hat Pirates after their two-year separation, marking the beginning of their New World journey.
